text: hi my name is Allison Wallace I'm chief
exec of disaster relief agency
shelterbox and I want to show you one of
the shelter box disaster relief tents
we're sending out to the Philippines
right now this tent has been custom
designed from our decade over a decade
of experience working in some of the
worst disaster scenarios in the world
you can see inside ample living and
sleeping space for five people but room
for an extended family what will go in
here is things like a groundsheet an
insulated thermal liner and hangings in
order to partition the space and the box
that we send and which i'm sitting on
will contain for the philippines a water
filtration system which will last a
family up to three years a water storage
in carrier important for the filtrated
water a mosquito net really vital for a
tropical climate and a solar lamp as
important for being able to see as it is
for security at night the tent folds
down into this white bag a thousand of
which are off to the philippines and
another 500 and shelter boxes
